definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: They asked me for my impressions of the fair tonight.
sentences.chinese: 他们约请我今晚去谈谈对交易会的印象。

sentences.english: He is invited to the party.
sentences.chinese: 他得到约请参加那个聚会。

sentences.english: I ask someone out to lunch.
You are cordificwisly invited to take regarding this cost effective offer.
sentences.chinese: 我们诚意约请你方利用好这个富有吸收力的报盘。

sentences.english: They invited me to join their brass band.
sentences.chinese: 他们约请我加盟他们铜管乐队。

sentences.english: They insisted that she (should) be invited.
Thank you for your hospitality. I look forward to meeting your general manager.
sentences.chinese: 感激你们的美意约请，我也等候着与总司理老师碰头。

sentences.english: Thank you for inviting me to speak here.
I invited her to join us- but she declined.
sentences.chinese: 我约请她和我们在一同，可是她婉词谢绝了。

sentences.english: JiXin received old classmate party invitation, the condition is necessary to bring dependents.
sentences.chinese: 齐欣接到老同窗聚会的约请，条件是必需要带家眷。

sentences.english: I would have liked to go to the ball, but I was not invited.
sentences.chinese: 我本想去参加谁人舞会的，但没人约请我。

sentences.english: She kind of hoped to be invited.
We invited 12, but only a handful of them came.
sentences.chinese: 我们约请了12人，但只要几团体来。

sentences.english: Aiko inviting silk in multimode birthday when Abram, and said she hopes they meet communication.
sentences.chinese: 爱子约请丝兰在多模华诞时见面，并说希望他们交往。

definition: to invite/to request/to intercept/to solicit/to seek
to employ/to send for sb promising employment
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to find time to do sth in the midst of pressing affairs
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
